title: The St. Patrick's Day Mystery
description: When the students walk into their classroom and find it decorated for St. Patrick's Day, Ms. McBride insists she didn't do it-it must have been leprechauns! As she explains to the children about leprechauns and their magic, Aja thinks she knows the truth. But after the fire alarm, Aja comes to believe that maybe leprechauns are real after all.
highFrequencyWords: abuzz, decorations, glittery, magical, shamrocks, speechless, strange
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: R-Controlled Vowels : Identify and categorize r-controlled vowel sounds
awareness: Possessive Nouns                : Identify and understand the use of possessive nouns
phonics: Suffixes : Apply suffix -ed to change the tense of a verb
grammar:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
